intro: Uncaria africana var. bequaertii, commonly known as African climbing tea, is a woody vine native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its twining stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers followed by red, fleshy berries that contain the seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and traditional medicinal uses. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
